data.title: William Cook
data.meta_description: William Cook is an Anglo-German journalist and author with a lifelong passion for Central and Eastern Europe. He writes for The Independent, The Telegraph, and The Spectator. He has won several awards for his travel writing, including the Johann Strauss Gold Medal for his reporting from Vienna. He edited the best-selling anthology, Tragically I Was an Only —The Complete Peter Cook, and its sequel, Goodbye Again–The Definitive Peter Cook & Dudley Moore (both published by Random House). His most recent book is One Leg Too Few–The Adventures of Peter Cook & Dudley Moore (Random House). He is married with two children and lives in London, where he was born and raised.
data.text: William Cook is an Anglo-German journalist and author with a lifelong passion for Central and Eastern Europe. He writes for The Independent, The Telegraph, and The Spectator. He has won several awards for his travel writing, including the Johann Strauss Gold Medal for his reporting from Vienna. He edited the best-selling anthology, Tragically I Was an Only —The Complete Peter Cook, and its sequel, Goodbye Again–The Definitive Peter Cook & Dudley Moore (both published by Random House). His most recent book is One Leg Too Few–The Adventures of Peter Cook & Dudley Moore (Random House). He is married with two children and lives in London, where he was born and raised.
